Course Description: THIS COURSE IS AN IN-DEPTH STUDY OF FINANCIAL REPORTING CONCEPTS AND GENERALLY ACCEPTED PRACTICE FOR BUSINESS COMBINATIONS, CONSOLIDATED ENTERPRISES, FOREIGN OPERATIONS, PARTNERSHIPS, NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, AND GOVERNMENT ENTITIES.  EMPHASIS ON ANALYZING FINANCIAL EVENTS AND THE CONSEQUENCES OF FINANCIAL REPORTING ALTERNATIVES.  PREREQUISITE: ACG 3111. 3 SEMESTER HOURS CREDIT
Textbook(s): ADVANCED ACCOUNTING, 7TH EDITION, JOE B. HOYLE, THOMAS F. SCHAEFER, TIMOTHY S. DOUPNIK, MCGRAW-HILL.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
